messageBody:
> I want to be able to either use textui or swingui to call my set of
> tests, so I have the following:

if you want that your tests share a property (like the url), you can use
the PropertyManager of the JUnit-addons library. In your case, you can
register a new property at startup and call it in the test's setup:

public class MyTest extends TestCase {

private SoapClient client;

protected void setUp() throws Exception {
String url = PropertyManager.getProperty("url-key");
client = SoapClient.getInstance(url);
client.setKeepAlive(true);
}

public void testXYZ() {
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
PropertyManager.setProperty("url-key", args[0]);
junit.swingui.TestRunner.run(MyTest.class);
}

But of course you'll have to install JUnit-addons
<http://junit-addons.sf.net>

-Vladimir

PS: since I've written most of JUnit-addons classes, I'm biaised but
that's simply what I use every day.
